decks.notes: The main concept of this control deck featuring Geist of Saint Traft as the commander is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining a strong board presence. This deck includes a wide variety of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures to control the tempo of the game. By using cards like Force of Will, Mana Leak, and Spell Pierce, the deck aims to counter key threats from the opponent. Additionally, cards like Path to Exile, Detention Sphere, and Swords to Plowshares provide removal options for problematic creatures. The inclusion of disruptive creatures like Vendilion Clique and True-Name Nemesis adds another layer of control by disrupting the opponent's hand and preventing them from effectively attacking. Overall, this deck focuses on slowing down the opponent's game plan while establishing a strong battlefield presence with Geist of Saint Traft.

The deck focuses on utilizing Jace, Vryn's Prodigy as the commander to control the game through card advantage, disruption, and tempo plays. It includes a wide range of counterspells, card draw spells, bounce effects, and extra turn spells to outvalue opponents and protect its key pieces. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to provide additional win conditions and board control. The mana base consists of Snow-Covered Islands and utility lands like Minamo, School at Water's Edge to ensure consistent mana production. Overall, the deck aims to control the game by countering threats, drawing cards, and generating incremental advantages until it can secure a win with its powerful spells and permanents.

The deck revolves around utilizing Doran, the Siege Tower as the commander to lead an aggressive strategy. With a mix of mana acceleration, disruptive creatures, and powerful removal spells, the deck aims to put pressure on opponents while controlling the board. Doran's ability to change the power and toughness of creatures opens up various combat options, allowing for efficient attacks and defenses. The deck includes a variety of efficient threats and answers to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building its own board presence. By combining aggressive creatures with disruptive elements, the deck seeks to overwhelm opponents and secure victory through a combination of combat damage and resource denial.

The deck revolves around utilizing Jace, Vryn's Prodigy as the commander to control the game through a combination of powerful spells and disruptive creatures. The main strategy involves countering opponent's spells, bouncing or stealing their creatures, and manipulating the board state with cards like Cyclonic Rift and Vedalken Shackles. The inclusion of extra turn spells like Time Warp and Temporal Manipulation allows the player to generate card advantage and stay ahead in the game. The deck also features a strong Eldrazi package with cards like Emrakul, the Promised End and Reality Smasher to close out the game quickly if needed. With a focus on controlling the game and out-valuing the opponent, the deck aims to win through resource denial and overwhelming board presence.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by countering spells, removing threats, and disrupting the opponent's plans while setting up for a win condition with Dragonlord Ojutai. The deck includes a variety of counter spells like Counterspell, Cryptic Command, and Force of Will, as well as removal spells such as Swords to Plowshares and Wrath of God. It also includes card draw and selection cards such as Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Ponder to help find the necessary pieces to maintain control. The inclusion of lands like Wasteland and Tectonic Edge also allows for disruption of the opponent's mana base, giving the deck additional control options.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize Grand Arbiter Augustin IV's ability to control the game by taxing spells and making opponents' spells more expensive to cast. This deck focuses on disruption, card advantage, and stalling tactics to slow down opponents and control the battlefield. With a mix of counter spells, removal, and bounce effects, this deck aims to maintain control of the game while setting up win conditions with powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and cards like Sphinx's Revelation. The deck also includes land destruction elements to further disrupt opponents' resources and strategies, preventing them from gaining momentum and securing victory through attrition and control.

The primary strategy of this deck is to utilize Jenara, Asura of War as the commander in an aggressive manner. The deck is filled with efficient creatures and disruption spells to maintain pressure on the opponent while controlling the board. Cards like Swords to Plowshares, Daze, and Force of Will help to disrupt the opponent's strategy while cards like Voice of Resurgence, Stoneforge Mystic, and Restoration Angel provide value and threats. The deck also includes powerful utility cards like Sylvan Library, Birthing Pod, and Survival of the Fittest to ensure consistency and adaptability in different situations. Overall, the deck aims to apply consistent pressure with aggressive creatures and disruption spells to secure victory in a Duel Commander 1 vs 1 format.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize Selvala, Heart of the Wilds' ability to generate large amounts of mana to power out powerful combo pieces and creatures quickly. This deck aims to ramp up quickly with cards like Elvish Mystic, Fyndhorn Elves, and Rofellos, Llanowar Emissary, to enable explosive plays with cards like Tooth and Nail, Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, and Eldrazi Temple. The deck also includes a variety of tutors like Green Sun's Zenith and Worldly Tutor to find key combo pieces like Umbral Mantle and Selvala's second ability to draw cards and generate even more mana. Overall, the strategy revolves around accelerating mana production to play high-impact threats and combo pieces to overwhelm opponents in a fast-paced 1 vs 1 duel commander format.
